explanation: To determine whether lfs_mount_ violates the MISRA requirement that every for-loop be well-formed, we must inspect the bodies of any called functions (and relevant transitive callees) because MISRA treats the behaviour of a for-loop body as including the behaviour of functions called within it. Even though lfs_mount_ itself contains no for-statement, any for-loops inside functions it calls (or inside functions those callees call) must be checked. For each symbol above: - Direct callees of lfs_mount_ (lfs_init, lfs_pair_isnull, lfs_tortoise_detectcycles, lfs_dir_fetchmatch, lfs_tag_isdelete, lfs_dir_get, lfs_superblock_fromle32, lfs_fs_disk_version_major/minor, lfs_fs_prepsuperblock, lfs_min, lfs_dir_getgstate, lfs_gstate_iszero, lfs_tag_isvalid, lfs_alloc_drop, lfs_unmount_) must be inspected because their implementations execute as part of lfs_mount_ and may contain for-statements subject to MISRA rules. - Immediate callees of those functions (listed as transitive symbols, e.g. lfs_init -> lfs_npw2, lfs_malloc, lfs_cache_zero, lfs_deinit; lfs_dir_fetchmatch -> lfs_bd_read, lfs_fromle32, lfs_scmp, lfs_tole32, lfs_crc, lfs_tag_dsize, lfs_frombe32, lfs_tag_isvalid, lfs_tag_type*, lfs_tag_chunk, lfs_bd_crc, lfs_tag_id, lfs_tag_splice, lfs_pair_fromle32, lfs_fcrc_fromle32, lfs_pair_swap, lfs_gstate_hasmovehere, lfs_min; lfs_dir_get -> lfs_dir_getslice, lfs_tag_size; lfs_superblock_fromle32 -> lfs_fromle32; lfs_fs_disk_version_* -> lfs_fs_disk_version; lfs_dir_getgstate -> lfs_dir_get, lfs_gstate_fromle32, lfs_gstate_xor; lfs_alloc_drop -> lfs_alloc_ckpoint; lfs_unmount_ -> lfs_deinit) are included because a for-loop in any of those bodies also must be validated. - lfs_min and lfs_deinit appear multiple places; they are included because they are used directly or transitively and their implementations could contain for-loops or modify objects referenced by loop clauses. In short, to conclusively determine MISRA conformance for lfs_mount_, inspect the implementations of every listed symbol (direct callees and the transitive callees shown) for any for-statements and verify each for-statement satisfies the three-clause restrictions (single loop counter, clauses’ side-effects/uses, and the body not modifying the loop counter except via the third clause).
